text: The third-generation iPhone SE is a smartphone developed and designed by Apple Inc. It is the successor to second-generation iPhone SE, which was released in April 2020. Apple announced the device on March 8, 2022 with pre-orders set on March 11, 2022. It was released on March 18, 2022. The new iPhone SE uses the A15 chip found in the iPhone 13 Pro and 13 Pro Max devices. Like the iPhone 8, it retains the Touch ID fingerprint sensor inside a physical home button, and a 4.7″ LCD screen (compared to the smaller 4.0″ screen on the original iPhone SE). It is available in the colors Midnight, Starlight, and (Product)RED. All color finishes of the phone have a black front. == References == Category:Mobile phones with 4K video recording Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2022 Category:IPhone
title: IPhone SE (3rd generation)
